skill.name: gene-database
skill.description: Query NCBI Gene via E-utilities/Datasets API. Search by symbol/ID, retrieve gene info (RefSeqs, GO, locations, phenotypes), batch lookups, for gene annotation and functional analysis.
skill.summary: Query NCBI Gene via E-utilities/Datasets API. Search by symbol/ID, retrieve gene info (RefSeqs, GO, ...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: This skill queries legitimate NCBI gene databases using standard HTTPS APIs. No malicious capabilities detected. Code is clean, readable, and performs only intended bioinformatics functions.

content.user_title: Query NCBI Gene Database for Genomic Research
content.value_statement: Access comprehensive gene information from NCBI's authoritative database. Search by gene symbols or IDs to retrieve sequences, annotations, pathways, and phenotypes for bioinformatics research.
actual_capabilities: Search genes by symbol, ID, or biological terms
Retrieve gene sequences and RefSeq annotations
Access Gene Ontology terms and pathways
limitations: Requires internet connection for API access
Rate limited without NCBI API key
Limited to NCBI Gene database content
Some genes may have incomplete annotations

use_cases.title: Gene Annotation Pipeline
use_cases.description: Annotate gene lists with comprehensive metadata including sequences, GO terms, and pathways for genomic studies.

use_cases.title: Disease Gene Discovery
use_cases.description: Identify genes associated with specific diseases or phenotypes using structured queries and filters.

use_cases.title: Cross-Species Comparison
use_cases.description: Compare gene orthologs across species to study evolutionary relationships and functional conservation.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Gene Search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for the BRCA1 gene in humans and show me its chromosomal location and function

prompt_templates.title: Disease Association
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all genes associated with diabetes in humans and list their symbols and descriptions

prompt_templates.title: Batch Annotation
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a list of gene symbols: TP53, EGFR, KRAS. Get their full annotations including sequences and pathways

prompt_templates.title: Pathway Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all genes involved in the insulin signaling pathway in humans with their genomic locations

output_examples.input: Search for BRCA1 gene in humans

best_practices: Always specify organism when searching by gene symbol to avoid ambiguity
Use batch operations for multiple genes to minimize API calls
Include NCBI API key for higher rate limits and faster queries
Cache frequently accessed gene data locally to reduce redundant queries
anti_patterns: Searching without organism filters may return genes from multiple species
Making sequential single-gene queries instead of batch operations
Ignoring rate limits may cause temporary API blocks
Not validating gene symbols before batch processing leads to errors

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Claude versions?
faq.answer: Yes, works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. No special requirements needed.

faq.question: What are the query limits?
faq.answer: Without API key: 3 requests/second. With free NCBI API key: 10 requests/second.

faq.question: Can I integrate with other bioinformatics tools?
faq.answer: Yes, outputs standard JSON format compatible with common bioinformatics pipelines.

faq.question: Is my query data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, queries go directly to NCBI servers. No data is stored or logged locally.

faq.question: What if a gene is not found?
faq.answer: The skill returns 'NOT_FOUND' status. Check spelling or try alternative gene symbols.

faq.question: How current is the gene data?
faq.answer: Data comes directly from NCBI's live databases, always up-to-date with latest annotations.
